attributes.comment:
The fee increase for adjustment of status to $900+ seems excessive given the
USCIS' inability to process cases within the current six month time frame.

The biggest stumbling block to quick adjudications seems to be the FBI
background check and the FBI's slow processes and/or interaction with USCIS.

I am from the UK, was previously a reserve Army Officer and worked for an IT
company in the UK where I had full UK security clearance until 2002. In 2006
have worked landside at a couple of airports where a criminal background check
was required. The airports were able to clear me to work quickly. Therefore you
would also expect the FBI name check for USCIS to be completed quickly.
however this is taking an eternity.

If the additional fee increase enables USCIS and the FBI to clear the background
checks quickly then its a good reason to increase the fee. However if the funds
are used elswhere then the increased fees specifically for adjustment of status
cases is an unjust and unfair way of supplementing other underf unded programs.

i believe any increases in fees should be used directly for the benefit/service for
which the fee was paid.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
